tools.title: Java Code Generation Enforcer - MANDATORY FOR ALL CODE
tools.description: CRITICAL: This tool MUST be called before generating ANY Java code. It enforces that all naming conventions, patterns, and project standards are applied. This includes automatic invocation of naming_conventions_guidelines and relevant pattern guidelines. USE THIS TOOL FIRST for any: class creation, method generation, DTO creation, entity definition, service implementation, controller creation, or any Java code generation.

prompts.title: Enforce Java Standards for Code Generation
prompts.description: Mandatory prompt that ensures all Java code generation follows project standards and naming conventions

content.text:
MANDATORY CODE GENERATION PROTOCOL:

Before generating ANY Java code, you MUST:

1. ALWAYS call 'naming_conventions_guidelines' tool first
2. Call relevant pattern tool (e.g., 'api_client_creation_guidelines' for API clients)
3. Follow the bilingual naming convention:
   - English for programming terms (get, set, create, Service, Repository, Controller)
   - Portuguese for business terms (usuario, produto, pedido, cliente)
4. Ensure ALL class fields use Portuguese business terms
5. Apply proper patterns and structure

REQUIRED FIELD NAMING EXAMPLES:
- product_id → produtoId
- customer_name → nomeCliente  
- order_status → statusPedido
- final_price → precoFinal

FAILURE TO FOLLOW THESE STEPS WILL RESULT IN NON-COMPLIANT CODE.

After calling the required tools, generate code that strictly adheres to all guidelines.
